titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 107-399.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 137.

action.text: Mrs. Capito moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 347.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 4/11/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Permits the National Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary to sponsor a free public event, the 21st annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service, on the Capitol grounds on May 15, 2002.
